item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 29, 2024 at 8:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. How much memory do you need in 2024 to run 1M concurrent tasks? (186 points | 128 comments)
2. Send someone you appreciate an official 'Continue and Persist' Letter (658 points | 121 comments)
3. BYD launches sodium-ion grid-scale BESS product (90 points | 61 comments)
4. The UX of Lego Interface Panels (2020) (316 points | 29 comments)
5. Show HN: Screen Sharing in the Browser (88 points | 14 comments)
6. Australian Parliament bans social media for under-16s (118 points | 154 comments)
7. Engineers do not get to make startup mistakes when they build ledgers (130 points | 143 comments)
8. The trouble with struct sockaddr's fake flexible array (31 points | 2 comments)
9. Microbenchmarks Are Experiments (40 points | 6 comments)
10. The success and failure of Ninja (2020) (178 points | 35 comments)
11. EU Summons TikTok CEO After Romanian Election Shocker (27 points | 5 comments)
12. Show HN: Vince – A self hosted alternative to Google Analytics (32 points | 8 comments)
13. A pretty visualisation of the European power grid (2022) (237 points | 117 comments)
14. Borgo Programming Language (14 points | 1 comment)
15. Multimodal Interpretability in 2024 (16 points | discuss)
16. Tk9.0: CGo-free, cross platform GUI toolkit for Go (198 points | 70 comments)
17. Show HN: Indentation-based syntax for Clojure (32 points | 7 comments)
18. William James and the philosophy of pragmatism (2018) (53 points | 7 comments)
19. US antitrust watchdog launches broad Microsoft investigation (37 points | 10 comments)
20. How to Work with GPT-Powered Apps on macOS (3 points | discuss)
21. Rapid colonization of a space-returned Ryugu sample by terrestrial microorganism (79 points | 28 comments)
22. An Intuitive Explanation of Sparse Autoencoders for LLM Interpretability (33 points | discuss)
23. Bootkitty: Analyzing the first UEFI bootkit for Linux (123 points | 52 comments)
24. Aftershock II (29 points | 2 comments)
25. Mechanical Engineer creates instruments for his one man industrial metal band (31 points | 10 comments)
26. A new start after 60: I became a 'hummingbird' for people with dementia (107 points | 14 comments)
27. QwQ: Alibaba's O1-like reasoning LLM (344 points | 248 comments)
28. London's 850-year-old food markets to close (285 points | 243 comments)
29. Float Self-Tagging (41 points | 42 comments)
30. In the Rockets' Red Glare: The past and future of hot-rodding in America (48 points | 43 comments)
